result.markdown:
---
title: "Example of working with R and Python codes using {Reticulate} package"
---


Below is an example to illustrate how to include executable code.

**R Code:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="show"}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="show"}
# day one, the age and speed of 12 cars:
x1 <- c(5,7,8,7,2,2,9,4,11,12,9,6)
y1 <- c(99,86,87,88,111,103,87,94,78,77,85,86)

# day two, the age and speed of 15 cars:
x2 <- c(2,2,8,1,15,8,12,9,7,3,11,4,7,14,12)
y2 <- c(100,105,84,105,90,99,90,95,94,100,79,112,91,80,85)

plot(x1, y1, main="Observation of Cars", xlab="Car age", ylab="Car speed", col="red", cex=2)
points(x2, y2, col="blue", cex=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](example_r_and_python_codes_files/figure-html/Observation of Cars-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Python Code:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="show"}
library(reticulate)
reticulate::use_python(python = "C://Users//mohit//anaconda3//envs//quarto_demo_website_py_env//python.exe")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code  code-fold="show"}
x = 5
y = 3

print(x + y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
8
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code  code-fold="show"}
import pandas as pd

data = {
  "calories": [420, 380, 390],
  "duration": [50, 40, 45]
}

#load data into a DataFrame object:
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

print(df) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   calories  duration
0       420        50
1       380        40
2       390        45
```
:::
:::


Add/Edit more contents [as you wish!]{.underline}
